message: It is nowhere supported in the article.  Rejected.
We can leave in "far-right."  The rest is simply not found in the article.  Do not revert.

That the cited source offers non-NPOV (and libelous) opinions about a person does not permit citing those opinions as fact.  Moreover, the article says nothing about Haywood's supposed "desires."  My language is entirely accurate, more complete, and more neutral.  Please do not revert.
Remove extra punctuation.

The earlier text is flatly incorrect as to what the citation says; it is now correct.  Please do not mis-characterize sources, especially with respect to living figures in an attempt to slander them.   Both "extremist" and "far-right" are non-NPOV and inappropriate here.
Remove characterization of Haywood based on negative unsourced opinion; correct language of reference to supposed reliable source to remove inaccurate summary found nowhere in the cited source.
Fourth correction of inaccurate summary of cited source.
Third correction of inaccurate summary of cited source, which does not claim that Haywood has "predicted" collapse, only that he has discussed it.
Second change, again to correct incorrect summary of cited source.

Correct inaccurate summary of "reliable source," which nowhere claims any insight into Haywood's "desires," but rather only claims (without citation or support) that he "has frequently speculated about his future as a warlord" and "he has repeatedly raised on the website is that he might serve as a 'warlord'."

Revert vandalism. Looking at the history, this editor has repeatedly tried to write this article in a biased manner, and has had to be corrected.  His desire to remove this sentence is appear to arise from desire to provide a one-sided picture of the subject. Citations of a subject's articles for color are the norm in all articles, and particularly necessary here, where this editor has written the article to make it appear that the subject is only criticized by "other right-wing commentators."

The cited article are not a "respository" and do not fit into any of the listed WP disfavored examples. Rather, they provide a fuller picture of Haywood's activities, and such examples are universal in WP articles about writers. However, I have moved the text further down as a counterpoint to cited criticism.
Add references to example writings outside his main site.
add link
